item.description:
@chri55w wrote:

[s]okay so i made a forcetext command to force a player to say what you type, eg ::forcetext player1 hello

however it wont work, there are no compiler errors but it always throws an exception :S

this is the command

if (playerCommand.startsWith("forcetext") && c.playerRights == 3) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); int Name = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int Text = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equals(Name)) { Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i]; o.forcedChat(" " + Text); } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Forced chat failed"); } }

[s]have no idea what the problem is lol

any help greatly appreciated :D[/s]

FIXED

if (playerCommand.startsWith("forcetext") && c.playerRights == 3) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split("_"); for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equals(args[1])) { Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i]; o.forcedChat((args[2])); } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Forced chat failed"); } }
